sentences.english: he was skilful at sketching. Suddenly, Abe suggested to go skiing.
sentences.chinese: 他素描画得很娴熟，突然，艾贝提议去滑雪。

sentences.english: The smith forged the plow with great skill.
sentences.chinese: 那铁匠技术娴熟地锻造马的蹄铁。

sentences.english: I was greatly impressed by the handiness with which she played the piano.
sentences.chinese: 她弹奏钢琴如此娴熟，给我留下了深刻印象。

sentences.english: You'll be surprised at how adept you become telling your crafting story.
sentences.chinese: 你会惊讶于如何娴熟成为你告诉你的故事，并不尽然。

sentences.english: They are skilled wielders of the eastern style composite bow.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林弓箭手对东方式复合弓使用娴熟。

sentences.english: About his recent artworks, its more proficient and clear of his using materials.
sentences.chinese: 他的近作对材料的使用更加娴熟也更加透彻。

sentences.english: They provide good service and skillfully brew tea for tea customers.
sentences.chinese: 茶博士为顾客提供良好的服务，娴熟地沏茶。

sentences.english: Why should the company provide the good service?
sentences.chinese: 茶博士为顾客提供良好的服务，娴熟地沏茶。
但他们的技术惊人地娴熟。

sentences.english: both technical command and poetic lyricism need to be cultivated.
sentences.chinese: 技巧的娴熟运用和诗意的抒情都需要培养。

sentences.english: I learned all I needed in high school. What I lacked was just exam-taking skills(Shan was not fully prepared for the exam).
sentences.chinese: 所有高中的知识我都掌握了，只是应试技巧不够娴熟。

sentences.english: Laurie had great skill, dazzling grace, and a winning smile.
sentences.chinese: 劳利技巧娴熟，优雅无比，面带必胜的喜悦。

sentences.english: A highly skilled technician trained them to drive tank.
sentences.chinese: 一名技术娴熟的技师训练他们如何驾驶坦克。

sentences.english: She is sending text messages with unerring skill, the keys are being tapped.
sentences.chinese: 她娴熟地发着短信，把手机按键按得不住地咔嗒响。

sentences.english: That path should be one that founders can skillfully navigate.
sentences.chinese: 而那条道路应该是创始人能够娴熟驾御的。

sentences.english: Instead he is just another very skillful, cheating footballer.
sentences.chinese: 但可惜他却成为了又一个技术娴熟的足球骗子。

definition: to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
exquisite/fine and delicate (usu. of works of art)
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
training in the basic skills/knowledge of the fundamentals
